description: Lenart Kova quietly unlocks and secures encrypted communications, enabling organizers and the recently restored 'ghost' citizens to coordinate civic assemblies outside Council surveillance.
Announcements for open city assemblies circulate widely, inviting residents of all backgrounds—including those previously erased—to discuss Stenograd’s future and challenge the Council’s legitimacy.

Large-scale grassroots elections are held for 'ghost assembly' representation, drawing high turnout in both score-blind and formerly restricted districts. Media attention grows as the movement spreads.

Reacting to the mass mobilization, Directorate officials circulate warnings against the assemblies, labeling the movement destabilizing. Arrests of organizers only heighten unrest and fuel larger protests.
The newly formed ghost assembly publishes a manifesto demanding a new social contract and open negotiations. The Council, under mounting public pressure, agrees to begin televised talks.
